content:
The Park Loop HIIT workout is a fantastic way to mix up your routine and challenge yourself. Here are some bodyweight exercises you can do at each corner of the loop:

**Corner 1: Squats**

* 10-15 reps of bodyweight squats, focusing on proper form and engaging your glutes and quads.
* You can also add variations like sumo squats, pistol squats, or goblet squats to challenge yourself.

**Corner 2: Push-Ups**

* 10-15 reps of push-ups, focusing on proper form and engaging your chest, shoulders, and triceps.
* You can also add variations like diamond push-ups, decline push-ups, or push-up rotations to challenge yourself.

**Corner 3: Lunges**

* 10-15 reps of alternating lunges, focusing on proper form and engaging your legs, glutes, and core.
* You can also add variations like walking lunges, side lunges, or curtsey lunges to challenge yourself.

**Corner 4: Burpees**

* 10-15 reps of burpees, focusing on proper form and engaging your entire body.
* You can also add variations like jump-over burpees, box jump burpees, or single-leg burpees to challenge yourself.

**Corner 5: Plank Jumps**

* 30-60 seconds of plank jumps, focusing on engaging your core and legs.
* Start in a plank position, then jump your feet up off the ground and back down, repeating the motion.

**Corner 6: Mountain Climbers**

* 30-60 seconds of mountain climbers, focusing on engaging your legs and core.
* Start in a plank position, then bring one knee up towards your chest and quickly switch to the other knee, mimicking the motion of running.

**Corner 7: Dips (using a bench or step)**

* 10-15 reps of dips, focusing on engaging your triceps and chest.
* Find a bench or step in the park, then place your hands on the edge and lower your body down, keeping your legs straight.

**Corner 8: Jumping Jacks**

* 30-60 seconds of jumping jacks, focusing on engaging your legs and cardiovascular system.
* Stand with your feet together, then jump your feet out to the sides while raising your arms above your head.

Remember to start with shorter intervals and gradually increase the duration as you build endurance. You can also mix and match these exercises or add your own favorites to keep the workout interesting and challenging. Don't forget to warm up properly, cool down, and listen to your body to avoid injury.
